englishNarrator: A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا, the wife of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ), reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا , verily Allah is kind and He loves kindness and confers upon kindness which he does not confer upon severity and does not confer upon anything else besides it (kindness).
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا, the wife of Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ), reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: Kindness is not to be found in anything but that it adds to its beauty and it is not withdrawn from anything but it makes it defective.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: This hadith has been reported by Miqdam bin Shuraih bin Hani with the same chain of transmitters but with this addition:
hadithEnglish: 'A'isha رضی اللہ عنہا mounted upon a wild camel and she began to make that go round and round. Thereupon Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: You should show kindness, and then he made a mention of this hadith.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Imran bin Husain رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: We were with Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) in some of his journeys and there was a woman from the Ansar riding a she-camel that it shied and she invoked curse upon that. Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) heard it and said: Unload that and set it free for it is accursed. 'Imran رضی اللہ عنہ said: I still perceive that (dromedary) walking amongst people and none taking any notice of that.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: I perceive as if I am looking towards that dromedary, and in the hadith transmitted on the authority of Thaqafi (the words are): Unload it and make its back bare for it is accursed.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Abu Burza al-Aslami رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: A slave-girl was riding a dromedary and there was also the luggage of people upon it. that she suddenly saw Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌). The way of the mountain was narrow and she said (to that dromedary): Go ahead (but that dromedary did not move). She (that slave-girl), out of anger, said: O Allah, let that (dromedary) be damned. Thereupon Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: Let the dromedary on which the curse has been invoked not proceed with us.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Sulaiman Taimi with the same chain of transmitters but with a variation of words (and that is):
hadithEnglish: By Allah, let that accompany us not which has been damned, or he said like it.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: It does not seem proper for a Siddiq that he should be an invoker of curse.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: A similar report (as no. 6608) was narrated from Al-Ala bin Abdur Rahman with this chain of narrators.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: 'Abdul-Malik bin Marwan sent some domestic goods for decoration to Umm Darda' on his own behalf, and when it was night 'Abd al-Malik got up and called for the servant. It seemed as if he (the servant) was late (in responding to his call), so he ('Abd al-Malik) invoked curse upon him, and when it was morning Umm Darda' رضی اللہ عنہا said to him: I heard you cursing your servant during the night when you called him, and she said: I heard Abu Darda' رضی اللہ عنہ as saying that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: The invoker of curse would neither be intercessor nor witness on the Day of Resurrection.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Zaid bin Aslam with the same chain of transmitters.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Umm Darda' reported on the authority of Abu Darda' رضی اللہ عنہ as saying:
hadithEnglish: I heard Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: The invoker of curse would neither be witness nor intercessor on the Day of Resurrection.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: It was said to Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ): Invoke curse upon the polytheists, whereupon he said: I have not been sent as the invoker of curse, but I have been sent as mercy.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: Two persons visited Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) and both of them talked about a thing, of which I am not aware, but that annoyed him and he invoked curse upon both of them and hurled malediction, and when they went out I said: Allah's Messenger, the good would reach everyone but it would not reach these two. He said: Why so? I said: Because you have invoked curse and hurled malediction upon both of them. He said: Don't you know that I have made condition with my Lord saying thus: O Allah, I am a human being and that for a Muslim upon whom I invoke curse or hurl malediction make it a source of purity and reward.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: This hadith has been reported on the authority of A'mash with the same chain of transmitters and the hadith transmitted on the authority of 'Isa (the words are):
hadithEnglish: He had a private meeting with them and hurled malediction upon them and cursed them and sent them out.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: O Allah, I am a human being and for any person amongst Muslims upon whom I hurl malediction or invoke curse or give him whipping make it a source of purity and mercy.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: Jabir رضی اللہ عنہ reported Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) a hadith like it but with a slight variation of wording.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been transmitted on the authority of A'mash and in the hadith transmitted on the authority of 'Isa the words are: Make it a source of reward, and in the hadith transmitted on the authority of Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ (the words are): Make it a source of mercy.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: O Allah, I make a covenant with Thee against which Thou wouldst never go. I am a human being and thus for a Muslim whom I give any harm or whom I scold or upon whom I invoke curse or whom I beat, make this a source of blessing, purification and nearness to Thee on the Day of Resurrection.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: This hadith has been transmitted on the authority of Abu Zinad with a slight variation of wording.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

hadithEnglish: A hadith like this has been reported on the authority of Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ through another chain of transmitters.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Salim, the freed slave of Nasriyyin, said: I heard Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ as saying:
hadithEnglish: He heard Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: O Allah, Muhammad is a human being. I lose my temper just as human beings lose temper, and I have held a covenant with Thee which Thou wouldst not break: For a believer whom I give any trouble or invoke curse or beat, make that an expiation (of his sins and a source of) his nearness to Thee on the Day of Resurrection.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: He heard Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) as saying: O Allah, for any believing servant whom I curse make that as a source of nearness to Thee on the Day of Resurrection.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: I have held covenant with Thee which Thou wouldst not break, so for any believer whom I curse or beat, make that an expiation on the Day of Resurrection.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship

englishNarrator: Jabir bin Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہ reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: I am a human being and I have made this term with my Lord, the Exalted and Glorious: For any servant amongst Muslims whom I curse or scold, make that a source of purity and reward.
chapterEnglish: The Book of Virtue, Enjoining Good Manners, and Joining of the Ties of Kinship
